title: Game Understanding Pedagogy (TGfU)-Based Mathematical Problem-Solving Education Using Nonlinear Instructional Methods

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical computational skills and problem-solving experience
context.additional_context: An educational program applying the TGfU model from physical education to mathematical problem-solving, emphasizing strategic thinking and nonlinear learning processes. Focuses on enhancing learners' autonomous problem-solving and critical thinking skills.

learning_goals: Learners can understand the core principles of Teaching Games for Understanding (TGfU) and apply them to mathematical problem-solving
Learners can demonstrate flexible strategic thinking in problem situations through nonlinear instructional methods
Learners can improve mathematical problem-solving processes through collaborative learning and self-reflection

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
